text: we have two capabilities that we're
going to announce today the first is the
AWS Marketplace for desktop apps and
what that will provide is a
Marketplace for the popular desktop
applications that companies and
customers are used to work using you'll
be able to provision them easily to run
on
workspaces and then instead of the
multi-year licensing model which has
been the norm forever you pay by the
month it's a very different pricing
model than has existed in the past and
you'll see in the marketplace for
desktop apps there are over a 100
desktop apps that are available at
launch today uh and they across 11
different categories that you can see on
the slide and it's not just Microsoft
Office it's uh you know some of the
other Microsoft apps like project and
Vio and visual studio but also the king
the the kingsoft office suite and you'll
see macafee you you see Adobe and you'll
see uh turbo CAD you'll see windzip and
you'll see get and GitHub you'll see a
Clips it's a broad selection of desktop
apps that are available to you to start
consuming by the
month the second thing that we're
announcing today is something called
workspaces application manager or Wham
and what that's intended to do is
simplify the problem I was talking about
earlier in packaging the those apps to
deploy to your
workspace to be able to have visibility
into how people are
using their licenses and and what
applications they're running and then
also it allows you to
automatically do patches and upgrades
and updates at scale those are big deals
and all the while while these desktop
applications are running as if they're
installed natively on your workspace
so both of these are available today it
the first offering the desktop
applications in our Marketplace changes
the model for how you can buy desktop
applications and then Wham allows you to
have a much easier way to manage
visibility to your various desktop apps
to package and to deploy them and then
to do updates and maintenance of scale
[Applause]
